title: Texas man is arrested for threatening San Antonio mayor 14 times in two days
text:
Adam Thomas Converse, 25, was arrested on Friday after he sent 14 threatening messages to Ron Nirenberg

A Texas man sent more than a dozen threatening messages to the San Antonio mayor over two days, writing on Facebook 'it would be nicer to leave you all dead'.

Adam Thomas Converse, 25, was arrested on Friday after he sent 14 threatening messages to Ron Nirenberg through Facebook Messenger on October 4 and 5.

'It would be nicer to leave you all dead with no hope of life after death... I want to see people dead', the San Antonio Express-News reported one of the messages read.

'People will lose hands, arms, feet, and heads. Don't even try me', read another, while others said 'I'll burn you' and 'I'll silence you all for good', the affidavit states.

In another message, Converse demanded money and wrote: 'I'm going to stab you'.

Nirenberg's communications director - who was not identified in the affidavit - reported the messages to the San Antonio Police after he noticed them on Facebook.

He told officers that his 'office feared [Converse] could be the next mass shooter based on his comments'.

Ron Nirenberg's (pictured) communications director reported the messages to the San Antonio Police after he noticed them on Facebook

San Antonio's Mental Health Unit visited Converse's home on October 5 and saw him walk out of his property with a machete on his belt loop.

He told officers 'he was a contract assassin with the government and if he had a license to kill, he would kill people', the affidavit said.

Converse then tried to resist arrest by placing his hands behind his back and attempting to brandish the machete on his belt, police said.

He was then transported to a hospital for evaluation and later arrested. He faces charges of making a terroristic threat to a public servant and resisting arrest.
